climbs.name: The Wife Beater
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon, Tucker Tech, Paul Blanchard

content.description:
This climb is on the left (southwest) arete of Bad Cop Rock and starts off boulders on the right edge of the west face.

Scramble up easy but unprotected moves to a high first bolt, where steep and positive climbing on patina jugs and plates lead right around the arete to a friction finish.

Fun climbing on decent rock but it's lack of height is a factor. One star out of five.

climbs.name: Reach Around Cop
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon, Tucker Tech, Karlas Ogle, Tom Burke

content.description:
Located on Bad Cop Rock this is the left-most route on the south face.

A start in a short crack with a pin leads to a short section of face climbing past a bolt into a right-facing flake system with two more fixed pins. Easy moves finish to anchors on the top. Additional protection (to 2") is not really needed but could be placed if desired.

A mixed route that with all the fixed gear is more a sport route. Fun moves on so-so rock. One star out of five.

climbs.name: Copulator
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon, Karlas Ogle, Tucker Tech, Tom Burke

content.description:
Yet another route on the illustrious Bad Cop Rock. Start just left of the

Bad Lieutenant

(5.8) and climb a left slanting crack to face past a bolt joining Reach Around Cop near the top.

Somewhat of a variation route with a few decent friction moves leftward past the bolt. One star out of five.

This climbs the east face of Bad Cop Rock (around the corner from Bad Lieutenant) via steep edges and some technical moves.

Good but sharp rock and lack of height make this a good TR. One and a half stars out of five.

climbs.name: The Bad Lieutenant
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon, Geroge Armstrong, Charles, Jose Pereya

content.description:
This fun route is the right arete of Bad Cop Rock (aka: Boulder 1) which is the large light-colored block just uphill from the Live and Let Die Boulder (aka: Boulder 2).

Very well-protected with fun and varied moves for the entire length of the climb - too bad this doesn't keep going for another 100' or so. A recommended route for the area nonetheless.

Good position, great moves but grainy rock and on the short side. Two stars out of five.

climbs.name: Bad Cop, No Donut
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon, Karlas Ogle, Tom Burke  Direct: Chris Miller

content.description:
Starting off a boulder climb a short crack to face then traverse straight left to reach the crack/flake of Reach Around Cop and finish up that route. A direct finish (5.11b) has been done straight up past the bolt and involves thin fingery moves with steep smears for the feet.

Essentially a variation to

Reach Around Cop

that's not as good as that route. Half a star out of five (is that possible ?).
content.location:
Located on Bad Cop Rock (as you may have guessed) this is the next route to the right of the

Reach Around Cop

and is identified as a crack to face with one bolt.
